result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald W Walters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>10,000g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)5.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

No use or consumption of intoxicants.  No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety.    Defendant shall not enter any establishment in which their primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  No possession of subscription drugs without a valid prescription in your name.  No contact with drug users or dealers.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by calling the Work Release Unit  at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919 WITHIN 72 HOURS OF SENTENCING to set up an appointment.   The Work Release Units hours are 8:00 am-4:00 pm/Monday thru Friday. Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats. 946.52.

timeConds.notes:
6 months  consecutive with no credit.  No good time.  Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant shall report to the Work Release Unit (M-F/7:30 am to 3:30 pm), within 72 hours of sentence date with a copy of the minute sheet and the completed GPS application to establish report date for serving sentence.  Report date shall be within 60 days of sentence date.  Huber shall be revoked for failure to report and a warrant shall be authorized.

6 months IMPOSED AND STAYED consecutive (with huber).  Stay may be lifted, in whole or in part, upon written request of the agent with approval and order of the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

MANU/DEL THC: CONDITIONS:   No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program.
